item.title: Kerb sunk away from pavement on drip kerb, 26th August
item.description:
This is outside my home and I've noticed it's getting worse, the kerb has sunk/moved away from the pavement causing a gap between them, this is causing constant issues when mine and other vehicles are parking on my driveway, I have to try to go in at another angle to avoid catching my tyres on the kerb. It's so uneven it's going to cause damage soon to vehicle

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Lime Grove, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Between 62 and 64 hillfield park, 26th August
item.description:
I am writing in relation to the tree situated between numbers 62 and 64. A section of asphalt in this area was recently laid and patched; however, despite the short timescale, the surface is already showing signs of cracking. There also appears to be evidence of root activity beneath the surface. Given these concerns, I kindly request that this matter be investigated, as there is a risk that the roots may be intruding into the properties. Thank you for your attention to this issue. I look forward to your response.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hillfield Park, Palmers Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Red paint spilled or thrown over road, 26th August
item.description:
Red paint has been spilled or thrown over road at jct of Elizabeth Way and Crowhurst Way. Is it possible for this to be washed away to avoid damage to passing vehicles and pedestrians being splashed?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Elizabeth Way, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin bags near Le Delice bins on George Lane, 26th August
item.description:
I have reported this before but someone keeps leaving rubbish bags on the street on George Lane next to the Le Delice grundon bin. They are dumped on the street late at night and then the foxes get at the bin bags, leaving rubbish strewn all over the pavement and street. It is a public health issue and needs to be cleaned up ASAP. Preventative action also needs to be taken as this has happened regularly for the past 6 weeks in exactly the same spot (likely by the same culprit).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 221, George Lane, Hither Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No white lines to define or show vehicles how to park, 26th August
item.description:
The parking area at the top of Richborough Close can easily accommodate 5 cars but because some selfish individuals that can't seem to park properly maybe because of the lack of painted white lines regularly only three or four vehicles are parked at the top of the road, which then others who live at houses 11,12,13,14,15,16 who seem to think the spaces belong to them park behind so vehicles become double parked or vehicles will be parked in the middle of the road blocking the road to vehicles such as dust carts or other rubbish collectors, the parking issue could also be seen as a fire hazard as emergency vehicles wouldn't be able to access the close.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Richborough Close, St Mary Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping dumping of furniture and general household waste, 26th August
item.description:
Someone has dumped a couple of items of furniture and some bags of general waste across the road from the pub at 1-3 Witham Road. The foxes will start ripping up the waste further, so it would be great to sort it out now before it inevitably gets worse! Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Witham Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge branches have broken - left hanging could be very dangerous, 26th August
item.description:
There are three high branches very big that have obviously broken in the wind. They’re all hanging and if it were to be windy they could fall on to pedestrians It’s a huge tall tree as you walk into kings meadows from minster road on your left

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Foxbury Close, Plaistow, London
